Threat: Attackers abuse the service, e.g., lack of rate limiting
Attackers access information, including secrets, through misconfiguration, errors, or logging
Mitigation: Limit information leakage, e.g., via hardened configuration

Threat: Attackers access information, including secrets, through misconfiguration, errors, or logging
Mitigation: Use secure methods to handle secrets and other sensitive information

Threat: Attackers bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access
Attackers can deceive users into clicking on hidden elements
Mitigation: Employ frame-busting scripts, set X-Frame-Options header, and enforce Content Security Policy

Threat: Attackers can exploit vulnerabilities in third-party dependencies leading to security breaches
Mitigation: Regularly update dependencies, use dependency scanning tools, and follow best practices for secure coding

Threat: Attackers can inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users
Mitigation: Implement input validation, output encoding, and enforce Content Security Policy (CSP)

Threat: Attackers cause denial of service through resource exhaustion
Mitigation: Implement rate limiting and resource throttling

Threat: Attackers craft and inject malicious content, e.g., SQLi
Mitigation: Implement proper parsing and input validation

Threat: Attackers exfiltrate data due to insecure backup procedures
Mitigation: Implement secure backup procedures with encryption and access controls

Threat: Attackers exploit misconfigurations in postgresql settings
Mitigation: Harden postgresql configuration and restrict network access
Regularly update postgresql to the latest secure version
Use parameterized queries and validate inputs

Threat: Attackers gain unauthorized access due to weak authentication
Mitigation: Implement robust authentication and role-based access control

Threat: Attackers intercept data due to unencrypted communications
Mitigation: Enforce TLS encryption for all connections

Threat: Attackers leverage deserialization flaws to execute malicious code
Attackers may exploit weaknesses in authentication and authorization mechanisms
Mitigation: Implement strong authentication mechanisms and follow the least privilege principle

Threat: Attackers tamper with data due to insecure file permissions
Mitigation: Enforce secure file permissions on PostgreSQL database files

Threat: Attackers use Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) to intercept communications
Mitigation: Secure communication channels, e.g., use TLS
